availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Perry (Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer, laborer, and soldier.)

body.p: Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Lewis County, Kentucky, native. Son of Eleanor "Nelly" Perry Eulett. Stepson of William N. Eulett. Married to Lydia Margaret Rose Perry. Farmer in Lewis County in 1860. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from September 28, 1863 to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, p. 185.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, Laurel Precinct, p. 478A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 432.
